page.title: 11BATTERY EGG FARM ON THE A53
page.content: The Egg-Packing Station is on the A53 and is about four kilometres from Shawbury. { One hundred and four thousand {chickens which are kept in}small cages. There are four rows of cages and four chickens in each cage. It is called a {battery farm;}some people think it is cruel to the hens but the eggs are cheap. All the hens' energy goes into{laying instead of running about. To drink they press their beaks against a lever and water drips out of a pipe. They{employ six men and nineteen {women full-time and twelve more at {weekends.} 50% are part-time, the rest are full-time workers. The women wear old clothes and blue checked overalls. The men wear jeans and T-shirts and sometimes overalls.
